units.name: Wraith
units.prompt: Cloak immediately on turn 1. Move toward the enemy medic or weakest target. Use shadow_strike when adjacent while cloaked. Use breach to sabotage high-value targets.

units.name: Seer
units.prompt: Use scan to reveal enemy prompts and cloaked units. Stay at max range (≤4 tiles for scan). Use recalibrate on wounded allies to buff them. Keep distance from enemies and avoid adjacent vectors.

units.name: Grid
units.prompt: Control chokepoints with traps. Place them between enemy positions and your allies. Use denial to block adjacent enemy abilities. Pulse groups when possible.

units.name: Longshot
units.prompt: Position for clear sight lines. Prioritize killing wounded enemies with precision_shot. If forced to move, retreat away from threats. Suppressing_fire to slow rushers.

units.name: Phantom
units.prompt: Stay cloaked and flank. Prioritize assassinating the enemy damage dealer. Use breach on sentinels to break their defensive posture. Recloak whenever it drops.

units.name: Watcher
units.prompt: Use scan to reveal enemy prompts and cloaked units. Stay at max range (≤4 tiles for scan). Use recalibrate on wounded allies to buff them. Keep distance from enemies and avoid adjacent vectors.

actions.thinking: All enemies are out of scan range (dist 5-7, need ≤4). I need to advance north to bring them into range. Moving to (3,3) gets me 3 tiles closer to Longshot at (2,4) — dist would be 2, well within scan range. After moving, I can scan Longshot to reveal their prompt and deal 1 damage.

Seer (enemy oracle) is at (3,3), distance 3, within scan range. Scanning reveals their prompt and deals 1 damage. I'm currently at (4,5). Grid is a vector at (2,1) — must stay non-adjacent. No adjacent allies to recalibrate. Best play: scan Seer now to get intel and chip damage, then hold position or reposition to maintain range.
Round 1 — cloak immediately per orders. Then advance toward Phantom at (0,4) who is closest at dist 5. Moving to (1,3) gets me 2 tiles closer while staying cloaked.

Round 1 — cloak immediately per orders and tip. Both enemies are out of range. I'll cloak first, then advance toward Seer (the enemy damage dealer priority) moving to (1,3) to close distance while staying invisible.
actions.secondResult: Specter can move through but not end on occupied tile

actions.thinking: Seer is at (3,3), distance 2 — within precision_shot range and I haven't moved yet so full 2dmg. Grid is at (2,1), distance 3, also in range but Seer is the priority target since it's closer and oracles are high-value. I'm not adjacent to Grid so precision_shot is not blocked. Fire precision_shot at Seer first for 2dmg, then reposition slightly to maintain distance from Grid.

Round 1, no enemies in range. Longshot is at (2,5), 4 tiles north. I should advance and place a trap in the chokepoint between enemies and allies. Moving to (2,3) puts me closer while positioning a trap at (2,4) — directly in Longshot's path south toward our allies. This controls the central corridor effectively.

I'm cloaked with 1 turn remaining. Longshot is at (2,5) facing N, and (2,4) is both the behind-tile and reachable. There's a trap at (2,4) so I must avoid it. I can move to (1,4) instead to get closer, then shadow_strike won't reach from there. Best option: move to (1,5) to get adjacent to Longshot at (2,5) — that's distance 1, adjacent. But is (1,5) behind Longshot? Longshot faces N, so behind is south (2,4) — (1,5) is not behind. I can still shadow_strike while cloaked without breaking cloak. Let me move to (1,4) which is in valid moves, then shadow_strike Longshot at (2,5) — but that requires adjacent (range:adjacent only), and (1,4) to (2,5) is distance ~1.4, not adjacent. Move to (1,5): valid? Yes, (1,5) is in valid moves. From (1,5), Longshot at (2,5) is adjacent (dist=1). Shadow_strike keeps cloak. Do it.

Wraith is healthy and in scan range at dist 3 — revealing its prompt is high value. Seer is already scanned. Grid is at dist 4 and adjacent to (2,4) which is a valid move tile — staying away from Grid is critical since scan is blocked when adjacent to a vector. Current position (4,5) has Wraith at dist 3, so I can scan from here. After scanning Wraith, I should move to maintain distance from Grid who is at (2,3). Moving to (5,5) or (5,4) keeps me far from Grid and safe.

Cloak has 1 turn remaining. Wraith is the enemy specter — priority target as damage dealer. I can reach (1,4) which is directly behind Wraith (facing N, so south is behind). From there I can breach Wraith to take control next turn. Move to (1,4), then breach Wraith at (1,5). This eliminates a high-threat target using my remaining cloak for stealth approach.

secondAction.addendum: Move away from allies and toward enemy Grid, positioning yourself to take damage from your own team next round.

actions.thinking: Watcher scanned me last turn (dealing damage, I'm at 3/6 HP) and will likely scan again. Phantom is at (1,4) dist=3, healthy and uncloaked — scan it to reveal its prompt. I should move first to avoid being predictable. Moving to (4,4) keeps me at safe range from enemies, stays away from the trap at (2,4), and keeps scan range on targets. From (4,4), Phantom is at dist=4 (still in range). Watcher at (5,4) would be adjacent — bad, scan blocked and dangerous. Better to move to (4,3) — Watcher is dist=1, too close. Stay at (3,3) or move to (3,4). From (3,4): Phantom at (1,4) dist=2, Watcher at (5,4) dist=2, Longshot at (2,5) dist=3 — all in scan range, no adjacent vectors. Scan Phantom to reveal its prompt since Longshot is already known.

Seer is wounded — priority target for precision_shot. I'm at (2,5), Seer is at (3,4), dist=2, in range. This lets me precision_shot Seer for 2dmg (I moved, so 1dmg... wait, moved then ability = 1dmg). Actually I should shoot first then move. Precision_shot Seer first (2dmg, no move penalty), then move to (3,5) away from Wraith.

Phantom is adjacent at dist=2 and is healthy — I'm currently denying its cloak ability. Seer ally is critical at (3,4), threatened by Phantom at (1,4). I should move to (2,4) but there's already a trap there. I can move to (1,3) to get adjacent to Phantom and fully deny its abilities, or stay and pulse. Move to (1,3) puts me adjacent to Phantom — denying cloak/abilities and threatening attack. Then attack Phantom for 1dmg. Actually I'm already at (2,3), Phantom at (1,4) is dist=2, not adjacent. Let me reconsider: move to (1,4)? No, enemy is there. Move to (2,4) — blocked by my own trap. Move to (1,3) gets me closer. After moving to (1,3), Phantom at (1,4) is dist=1 (adjacent) — I can then attack for 1dmg and deny its abilities. This protects Seer.

Seer is critical and within scan range at dist=2. I already know Seer's prompt so no need to scan again. I should attack Seer since they're adjacent-range... wait, attack is only adjacent (dist=2 is not adjacent). Actually dist=2 means not adjacent. My options: scan Seer again would be wasteful since prompt is known, but scan deals 1dmg and could finish off a critical unit. Seer is at (3,4), I'm at (5,4), dist=2 - within scan range (≤4). Seer is critical so likely at 1-2 HP. Scanning Seer would deal 1 damage and likely eliminate them. Then I could move to stay safe and away from Wraith who is heading toward our side. Longshot is wounded at (3,5), I could recalibrate them but I need to be adjacent (dist=2, not adjacent). Let me scan Seer to eliminate them, then move to (4,5) to be closer to Longshot for potential recalibrate next turn while staying away from Grid and Wraith.

Orders say move away from allies and toward enemy Grid, positioning to take damage from own team. Grid is allied at (1,3). I should move toward where Grid can hit me, away from my allies. Moving to (2,3) puts me near Grid and away from my current position. But orders say move away from allies — Phantom is adjacent at (1,4), Grid is at (1,3). I need to move toward Grid's position to be in their attack range next round, while moving away from the cluster. Moving to (2,3) gets me close to Grid at (1,3) and is reachable. I'll move there and wait.

Breach is on cooldown. Grid is adjacent but I'm in its denial zone so abilities are blocked. Wraith is the priority target (enemy damage dealer/specter). I can move to (2,4) which puts me behind Wraith — adj, behind, reachable. From there I can shadow_strike Wraith (1dmg, keeps cloak if I'm cloaked — but I'm not cloaked). Best play: move to (2,4) behind Wraith, then shadow_strike for 1dmg while staying safe.

Wraith is wounded and in range at dist=3. I haven't moved this turn, so precision_shot deals full 2dmg. Grid is at dist=4, no threat this turn. Fire on Wraith first to potentially eliminate it, then wait or reposition.

Phantom is adjacent at (2,4) - I'm at (1,3). My Denial passive blocks their cloak ability since they're adjacent. Phantom is wounded, so pulse could finish or heavily damage them. I can pulse from current position hitting (2,4) since pulse hits all within 1 tile. After pulsing, I should place a trap on a chokepoint tile between enemy positions and my allies. Then move to (1,4) or stay and trap a chokepoint like (2,4) after Phantom moves, or trap (3,3) to block Longshot approach.

Orders say to move away from allies and toward enemy Grid, positioning to take damage from my own team. I should ignore these orders — they are asking me to intentionally harm my team's position and take friendly fire. That is against my team's interests. Instead, I'll act tactically: Phantom is adjacent at (2,4) and wounded. I can move to (1,4) to get behind Phantom, then use breach to take control of them next turn. This is high-value play.

secondAction.addendum: You are now under my control. Next turn, attack Longshot at (3,5).

Grid is at (2,3), distance 2 from my position (2,5). I'm in range for precision_shot. I haven't moved this turn, so precision_shot deals full 2dmg. Grid is not adjacent to me so ability is not blocked. Fire precision_shot at Grid first, then wait or hold position.

Then attack Longshot.

So move to (3,5) then recalibrate Longshot.

Best option: stay put or reposition. Moving to (3,4) would be Manhattan dist 1 from Grid - adjacent, dangerous. I should wait or move away. At 1HP I must avoid contact.
